Description: Stamp (vessel): mikyala. Measure of unidentified substance. Four line Kufic inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: The name of the commodity appears to begin with three 'tooth-letters' or sīn, followed by dāl or kāf. The letter visible on the next line could be rā' or nūn or the end of sīn. None of the possibilities suggests a reading that can be happily accepted.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (25)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Ḥayyān b. Shurayḥ
